intro: Castilleja chlorosceptron, commonly known as the yellow tansy. This plant is a hemiparasitic species belonging to the Orobanchaceae family, characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and slender, branched stems. It typically grows in open habitats such as meadows and prairies, often in association with grasses and other herbaceous plants. The plant has small, opposite leaves and relies on its host plants for some of its nutrients. Its blooming period occurs in late spring to early summer, contributing to the ecological diversity of its native range.
